acceptOwnership().details: The new owner accepts the ownership transfer.

params._chainTypeManager: the state transition manager address to be added

params._baseTokenAssetId: asset id of base token to be registered
the base token asset id of the chain
params._factoryDeps: the factory dependencies for the chain's deployment
params._initData: the fixed initialization data for the chain
params._salt: the salt for the chainId, currently not used

params._expirationTimestamp: the expiration timestamp for the transaction

params._chainId: The chain ID of the migrating chain.
params._newSettlementLayerChainId: The chain ID of the new settlement layer.

returns.ctm: The address of the CTM of the chain.
returns.zkChain: The address of the ZK chain.

params._assetId: The asset ID of the chain.
params._baseTokenAssetId: The asset ID of the base token.
params._chainId: The chain ID of the ZK chain.

returns.ctm: The address of the CTM of the chain.
returns.zkChain: The address of the ZK chain.

params._chainId: The chain ID of the chain.

returns.ctm: The address of the CTM of the chain.
returns.zkChain: The address of the ZK chain.

returns.chainAddress: the address of the ZK chain

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

pauseMigration().details: Remove this with V30, the functionality was moved to the ChainAssetHandler in V29.

paused().details: Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise.

pendingOwner().details: Returns the address of the pending owner.

params._chainId: The chain ID of the ZK chain where to prove L1->L2 tx status.
params._l2BatchNumber: The L2 batch number where the transaction was processed
params._l2MessageIndex: The position in the L2 logs Merkle tree of the l2Log that was sent with the message
params._l2TxNumberInBatch: The L2 transaction number in the batch, in which the log was sent
params._merkleProof: The Merkle proof of the processing L1 -> L2 transaction
params._status: The execution status of the L1 -> L2 transaction (true - success & 0 - fail)

returns._0: Whether the proof is correct and the transaction was actually executed with provided status NOTE: It may return `false` for incorrect proof, but it doesn't mean that the L1 -> L2 transaction has an opposite status!

params._batchNumber: The executed L2 batch number in which the log appeared
params._chainId: The chain ID of the ZK chain where to prove L2 log inclusion.
params._index: The position of the l2log in the L2 logs Merkle tree
params._proof: Merkle proof for inclusion of the L2 log

returns._0: Whether the proof is correct and L2 log is included in batch

params._batchNumber: The executed L2 batch number in which the message appeared
params._chainId: The chain ID of the ZK chain where to prove L2 message inclusion.
params._index: The position in the L2 logs Merkle tree of the l2Log that was sent with the message
params._message: Information about the sent message: sender address, the message itself, tx index in the L2 batch where the message was sent
params._proof: Merkle proof for inclusion of L2 log that was sent with the message

registerAlreadyDeployedZKChain(uint256,a.details: Registers an already deployed chain with the bridgehub

params._chainId: The chain Id of the chain
The chainId of the legacy chain we are migrating.

registerNewZKChain(uint256,address,bool).details: Providing `_checkMaxNumberOfZKChains = false` may be preferable in cases where we want to guarantee that a chain can be added. These include: - Migration of a chain from the mapping in the old CTM - Migration of a chain to a new settlement layer

params._chainId: The chain ID of the ZK chain
params._checkMaxNumberOfZKChains: Whether to check that the limit for the number of chains has not been crossed.
params._zkChain: The address of the ZK chain's DiamondProxy contract.

params._isWhitelisted: whether the chain is a whitelisted settlement layer

params._chainTypeManager: the state transition manager address to be removed

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

params._request: the request for the L2 transaction

params._canonicalTxHash: The hash of the L1->L2 transaction to confirm the deposit.
params._chainId: The chain ID of the ZK chain to which confirm the deposit.
params._txDataHash: The keccak256 hash of 0x01 || abi.encode(bytes32, bytes) to identify deposits.

params._l1CtmDeployer: the ctm deployment tracker address. Note, that the address of the L1 CTM deployer is provided.

setCTMAssetAddress(bytes32,address).details: Used to set the assetAddress for a given assetInfo.

params._additionalData: the additional data to identify the asset

setPendingAdmin(address).details: Please note, if the owner wants to enforce the admin change it must execute both `setPendingAdmin` and `acceptAdmin` atomically. Otherwise `admin` can set different pending admin and so fail to accept the admin rights.

transferOwnership(address).details: Starts the ownership transfer of the contract to a new account. Replaces the pending transfer if there is one. Can only be called by the current owner.

L1_CHAIN_ID().notice: The chain id of L1. This contract can be deployed on multiple layers, but this value is still equal to the L1 that is at the most base layer.

MAX_NUMBER_OF_ZK_CHAINS().notice: The total number of ZK chains can be created/connected to this CTM. This is the temporary security measure.

acceptAdmin().notice: Accepts transfer of admin rights. Only pending admin can accept the role.

addChainTypeManager(address).notice: Chain Type Manager can be any contract with the appropriate interface/functionality

addTokenAssetId(bytes32).notice: asset id can represent any token contract with the appropriate interface/functionality

assetIdIsRegistered(bytes32).notice: we store registered assetIds (for arbitrary base token)

assetRouter().notice: all the ether and ERC20 tokens are held by NativeVaultToken managed by the asset router.

baseToken(uint256).notice: baseToken function, which takes chainId as input, reads assetHandler from AR, and tokenAddress from AH

baseTokenAssetId(uint256).notice: Mapping from chain id to encoding of the base token used for deposits / withdrawals

chainAssetHandler().notice: the chain asset handler used for chain migration.

chainTypeManager(uint256).notice: chainID => ChainTypeManager contract address, CTM that is managing rules for a given ZKchain.

chainTypeManagerIsRegistered(address).notice: ChainTypeManagers that are registered, and ZKchains that use these CTMs can use this bridgehub as settlement layer.

createNewChain(uint256,address,bytes32,u.notice: register new chain. New chains can be only registered on Bridgehub deployed on L1. Later they can be moved to any other layer.for Eth the baseToken address is 1

forwardTransactionOnGateway(uint256,byte.notice: Used to forward a transaction on the gateway to the chains mailbox (from L1).

forwardedBridgeBurnSetSettlementLayer(ui.notice: IL1AssetHandler interface, used to migrate (transfer) a chain to the settlement layer.

forwardedBridgeMint(bytes32,uint256,byte.notice: IL1AssetHandler interface, used to migrate (transfer) a chain to the settlement layer.

forwardedBridgeRecoverFailedTransfer(uin.notice: Used to recover a failed migration.

getAllZKChainChainIDs().notice: Returns all the registered zkChain chainIDs

getAllZKChains().notice: Returns all the registered zkChain addresses

getHyperchain(uint256).notice: return the ZK chain contract for a chainId

getZKChain(uint256).notice: Returns the address of the ZK chain with the corresponding chainID

initialize(address).notice: used to initialize the contractthis contract is also deployed on L2 as a system contract there the owner and the related functions will not be used

initializeV2().notice: Used to initialize the contract on L1

l1CtmDeployer().notice: The deployment tracker for the state transition managers.

l2TransactionBaseCost(uint256,uint256,ui.notice: This will be deprecated, use InteropCenter insteadforwards function call to Mailbox based on ChainId

messageRoot().notice: The contract that stores the cross-chain message root for each chain and the aggregated root.

migrationPaused().notice: used to pause the migrations of chains. Used for stopping migrations during upgrades.

pause().notice: Pauses all functions marked with the `whenNotPaused` modifier.

proveL1ToL2TransactionStatus(uint256,byt.notice: This will be deprecated, use InteropCenter insteadforwards function call to Mailbox based on ChainId

proveL2LogInclusion(uint256,uint256,uint.notice: This will be deprecated, use InteropCenter insteadforwards function call to Mailbox based on ChainId

proveL2MessageInclusion(uint256,uint256,.notice: This will be deprecated, use InteropCenter insteadforwards function call to Mailbox based on ChainId

registerLegacyChain(uint256).notice: Used to set the legacy chain data for the upgrade.

registerNewZKChain(uint256,address,bool).notice: This function is used to register a new zkChain in the system.

registerSettlementLayer(uint256,bool).notice: Used to register a chain as a settlement layer.

removeChainTypeManager(address).notice: Chain Type Manager can be any contract with the appropriate interface/functionalitythis stops new Chains from using the CTM, old chains are not affected

requestL2TransactionDirect((uint256,uint.notice: This will be deprecated, use InteropCenter insteadthe mailbox is called directly after the assetRouter received the deposit this assumes that either ether is the base token or the msg.sender has approved mintValue allowance for the nativeTokenVault. This means this is not ideal for contract calls, as the contract would have to handle token allowance of the base Token. In case allowance is provided to the Asset Router, then it will be transferred to NTV.

requestL2TransactionTwoBridges((uint256,.notice: This will be deprecated, use InteropCenter insteadAfter depositing funds to the assetRouter, the secondBridge is called  to return the actual L2 message which is sent to the Mailbox.  This assumes that either ether is the base token or  the msg.sender has approved the nativeTokenVault with the mintValue,  and also the necessary approvals are given for the second bridge.  In case allowance is provided to the Shared Bridge, then it will be transferred to NTV.The logic of this bridge is to allow easy depositing for bridges. Each contract that handles the users ERC20 tokens needs approvals from the user, this contract allows the user to approve for each token only its respective bridgeThis function is great for contract calls to L2, the secondBridge can be any contract.

routeBridgehubConfirmL2Transaction(addre.notice: Used to route confirmL2Transaction to legacy bridgesUsed by the InteropCenter to route the bridgehubConfirmL2Transaction.

routeBridgehubDeposit((address,uint256,a.notice: Used to route BridgehubDeposits to legacy bridges

setAddresses(address,address,address,add.notice: To set the addresses of some of the ecosystem contracts, only Owner. Not done in initialize, as the order of deployment is Bridgehub, other contracts, and then we call this.

setPendingAdmin(address).notice: Starts the transfer of admin rights. Only the current admin or owner can propose a new pending one.New admin can accept admin rights by calling `acceptAdmin` function.

unpause().notice: Unpauses the contract, allowing all functions marked with the `whenNotPaused` modifier to be called again.

whitelistedSettlementLayers(uint256).notice: shows whether the given chain can be used as a settlement layer.
